summary: This bill, the Commission to Relocate the Federal Bureaucracy Act, proposes the establishment of a commission to study the relocation of federal agencies outside of the Washington, D.C. metropolitan area. The commission, comprised of various government officials, would analyze factors like cost of living, infrastructure, and workforce telework participation to determine suitable relocation sites. The goal is to transfer at least 100,000 employees of covered agencies outside of the DC area. The commission will submit a report to Congress within a year of the bill's enactment.
